title: Gregg McNally
text:
Gregg McNally (born 2 January 1991) is an <a href="Ireland%20men%27s%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Ireland</a> international <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer plays as a for <a href="Rochdale%20Hornets">Rochdale Hornets</a> in the <a href="RFL%20League%201">RFL League 1</a>. He has played at representative level for England (Academy, 2008 tour of Australia) he started his career at <a href="Kells%20A.R.L.F.C.">Kells</a>, and at club level for <a href="Whitehaven%20R.L.F.C.">Whitehaven</a> (three spells, including the second during 2009, and the third during 2010 on <a href="Loan%20%28sports%29">loan</a> from <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield Giants</a>), <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield Giants</a>, <a href="Oldham%20R.L.F.C.">Oldham</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Oldham%20R.L.F.C.%20players">Heritage № 1264</a>) (<a href="Super%20League%23Dual%20registration">dual registration</a>), <a href="Barrow%20Raiders">Barrow Raiders</a> (<a href="Loan%20%28sports%29">loan</a>), <a href="Leigh%20Centurions">Leigh Centurions</a>, (<a href="List%20of%20Leigh%20Centurions%20players">Heritage № 1350</a>) (two spells), <a href="Whitehaven%20RLFC">Whitehaven RLFC</a> and in the <a href="Championship%20%28rugby%20league%29">Betfred Championship</a> for <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Bulls</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Bradford%20Bulls%20players">Heritage №</a>), as a <a href="Goal%20%28sports%29%23Rugby%20football">goal</a>-kicking or .
Background.
McNally was born in <a href="Whitehaven">Whitehaven</a>, <a href="Cumbria">Cumbria</a>, England, he has <a href="Irish%20people">Irish</a> <a href="ancestor">ancestor</a>s, and eligible to play for <a href="Ireland%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Ireland</a> due to the <a href="Grandfather%20rule">grandparent rule</a>. Gregg has grey hair.
Career.
Huddersfield Giants.
McNally was transferred from <a href="Whitehaven%20R.L.F.C.">Whitehaven</a> to the <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield Giants</a> during November 2008, after which he made his début in a friendly match against <a href="Halifax%20R.L.F.C.">Halifax</a> on Sunday 4 January 2009 and then returned to Whitehaven on loan for a season.
At youth level McNally scored 18 points to take <a href="The%20Whitehaven%20Academy">Whitehaven School</a> to the 2006–2007 national <a href="Champion%20Schools">Champion Schools</a> final, going on to take his team to victory in the final with three <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">tries</a>, qualifying for European competition.
Leigh Centurions.
McNally joined <a href="Leigh%20Centurions">Leigh Centurions</a> in time for the 2012 season. At the Leigh Centurions McNally has won 1 <a href="Championship%20Cup">Northern Rail Cup</a>, 3 <a href="League%20Leaders%27%20Shield">League Leaders' Shield</a>, and 1 <a href="Championship%20%28rugby%20league%29">Kingstone Press Championship</a> Grand Final.
Bradford Bulls.
In January 2018 NcNally joined <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Bulls</a> on a two-year deal. He was released by the Bulls in January 2019 on compassionate grounds.
Whitehaven.
On 4 December 2020 it was reported that McNally will return to <a href="Whitehaven%20R.L.F.C.">Whitehaven</a> for the 2021 season
Rochdale Hornets.
On 22 Oct 2021 it was reported that he had signed for <a href="Rochdale%20Hornets">Rochdale Hornets</a> in the <a href="RFL%20League%201">RFL League 1</a>
International honours.
In 2010 he represented Ireland at the <a href="2010%20European%20Cup">Alitalia European Cup</a>. Despite Ireland coming fourth of four McNally was the top points scorer of the competition.
He also represented Ireland in the <a href="2011%20Autumn%20International%20Series">2011 Autumn International Series</a>, and the <a href="2012%20European%20Cup%20%28rugby%20league%29">2012 European Cup</a>.
In 2016 he was called up to the <a href="Ireland%20men%27s%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Ireland</a> squad for the <a href="2017%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup%20qualification%20%E2%80%93%20Europe%23Group%20B">2017 Rugby League World Cup European Pool B qualifiers</a>.
